alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Menominee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 12:26AM EDT until April 20 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Menominee, Dickinson and Marinette Counties. Menominee River near Niagara affecting Florence, Menominee, Dickinson and Marinette Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Dickinson and Iron Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Florence, Forest, Dickinson and Iron Counties. For the Menominee River...including Florence, Vulcan, Niagara... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Vulcan. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Structures along the river along Homestead Road and Sturgeon Way Road may start to be impacted by floodwaters. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 PM CDT Saturday was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 17.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon to 13.7 feet early Friday afternoon. It will rise to 13.8 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 04/27/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon.
